docs.snippet: Donald Trump on Thursday praised aggressive police tactics and condemned attacks on officers amid criticism of his plan to use "stop-and-frisk" tactics to reduce crime, in a speech following a second night of unrest that shook Charlotte, North Car...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump on Thursday praised aggressive police tactics and condemned attacks on officers amid criticism of his plan to use "stop-and-frisk" tactics to reduce crime, in a speech following a second night of unrest that shook Charlotte, North Carolina.

headline.main: Trump Doubles Down on 'Law-And-Order' Appeal in White House Bid
headline.print_headline: Trump Doubles Down on 'Law-And-Order' Appeal in White House Bid

docs.lead_paragraph: An image purported to be a scanned copy of U.S. first lady Michelle Obama’s passport was leaked online on Thursday alongside personal emails said to belong to a low-level White House staffer who worked with Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign.

headline.main: U.S. Appeals Court Hears Arguments on Virginia's Voter ID Law
headline.print_headline: U.S. Appeals Court Hears Arguments on Virginia's Voter ID Law

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: "Your Majesty" isn't in the American political lexicon. But when a president sets a major policy by edict, skirting Congress, it invariably sets off a debate that traces back to the time of kings and queens — and the Founding Fath...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: "Your Majesty" isn't in the American political lexicon. But when a president sets a major policy by edict, skirting Congress, it invariably sets off a debate that traces back to the time of kings and queens — and the Founding Fathers who rejected the authority of the crown.

docs.snippet: A public forum on his push to change school funding. Opening a cancer institute. Dedicating a new high school. And, so no one could say he's not still having fun, Gov. Chris Christie also spent four hours hosting a sports talk radio show....
docs.lead_paragraph: A public forum on his push to change school funding. Opening a cancer institute. Dedicating a new high school. And, so no one could say he's not still having fun, Gov. Chris Christie also spent four hours hosting a sports talk radio show.

headline.main: Christie Works to Shore Up Legacy as Trial Threatens It
headline.print_headline: Christie Works to Shore Up Legacy as Trial Threatens It
